title: Human Governance vs AI Production Boundary
summary: Humans define invariants; AI operates strictly within them.
what_this_is: Defines the permanent separation between human governance and AI execution to prevent structural drift.
structural_problem: Without a fixed boundary, incremental edits and generation variance erode invariants.
rule: Humans control personas, constraints, schemas, thresholds, and architectural changes; AI generates rows and pages only within those fixed definitions.
tradeoff: Improvisation and out-of-scope optimization are disallowed.
failure_mode: Constraint mapping diverges, schemas fragment, gates lose consistency, and determinism breaks.
structural_impact: All evolution occurs through explicit architectural revision, never through generator behavior.
